result.execSummary:
The defendant Abigail J Block was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 06/10/15 SENTENCE CORRECTED TO PROBATION, SENTENCE WITHHELD.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Follow through with  AODA assessment, and with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Disclose to any physician your drug history/dependency.

No Contact with Merrill Hills Manor or any of its residents. Maintain full time employment and/or school combination.   Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Defendant is not to possess any firearms.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. Commencing 05/27/15 by 5pm.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

regarding treatment
character letter

list of medications
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.

Defendant Abigail J Block in court with attorney Michael Girard Penkwitz.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1,  Court finds defendant guilty.  

Court orders the following:
- Sentence withheld
- 3 years Probation. 
- Court costs of $278.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
- Conditions of Probation:  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Valid prescriptions to be taken in the manner they were prescribed and must provide verification that the physician was notified of drug history/dependency.  Disclose to any physician your drug history/dependency.  Maintain full-time employment and/or school.  No contact with Merrill Hills Manor or any of its residents.  Follow through with AODA treatment/counseling.  Defendant is not to possess any firearms.
CONDITION TIME: 10 days - NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - To commence on May 27, 2015 by 5:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 27, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

Defendant Abigail J Block in court with attorney Michael Girard Penkwitz.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date in about 6 weeks.  Court addresses WCS letter.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Hearing on April 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
